Classic game, much easier to play on a desktop than a console for sure. The physical movement controls can be a little floaty/slidey, but otherwise gameplay is smooth. There's a lot less handholding in this than more recent games—e.g. a scientist will tell you your objective, but it doesn't get recorded anywhere so too bad if you weren't paying attention, you gotta figure it out on your own lol. Level design is relatively straightforward, it's never a question of which path to take because there's pretty much only one or two (that will take you to the same place), but there is strategy of how best to proceed. Definitely not a dumb shoot 'em up sort of FPS.
This is the purest sample we've seen yet.

Half Life: Playing Half Life reminds me of a time where things are much more simpler.  Games are released in a complete state and expansion sets are a whole new game on it's own.

The Good: One of the best puzzle oriented FPS / Platformer out there. Subtle storytelling, great choice of weapons available.

The Bad: Where on earth is Half Life 3?!

Un clásico que todos deberían jugar .

Can't understand how people still praise this game. In this day and age this is just plain awful. The last level is almost unplayable. The controls are horrible and the entire parkour present in it is just broken, the game just throws you in without any experience too. If you fall into a pit or die some other way you just restart at almost the beginning of each level, that with the slow elevators and platforms to make it worse. The game is playable, but the last level is terrible, haven't quite seen anything like it. It's completely different from the rest of the game and any fun you might've been having before is lost.

Do not play the last level unless you absolutely need to play it. Wait for the Black Mesa remake to be finished, this is absolute garbage. Couldn't wait to finish this shitty game. I at least hope HL2 isn't this trashy.
